website_summaries.verdict: Great if you need a spout cover that fits a lot of faucets and is easy to put on and take off.
pros: Tail-shaped to allow you to hook it on a towel rack when you aren't using it
Can be put in the dishwasher to clean
Comes down far enough to keep your child from hitting the underside of the faucet
cons: Fits smaller spigots well, but if your bath spigot is over eight inches it might not work for your tub

customer_reviews.title: Can Catch Toes
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked this tub, now I loathe it. The roll up support is a joke. It offers no support for my son now that it is on the next "setting". Little toes can get bent in the holes used to hold the support. See pic. When my son was kicking around he managed to catch a pinky toe in that spot. Thankfully he didn't bend it too much. It takes forever to drain. I dry it well after each use and it still smells. I do not recommend this tub. At least the cat likes it so it looks like she has a new bed.
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: 000 people love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Why do over 2,000 people love this thing? Not only did it absolutely NOT fit on my faucet, but the strap used to adjust it isnt anchored in any way- so as you attempt to adjust it to fit the strap just silides out from one side or the other rather than being able to tighten. It was such a poor fit on our faucet and the strap so useless that we couldn't even BALANCE it on our faucet. It was also a brittle plastic and not a maleable silicone like I thought it would be. Not a fan and can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MSP

customer_reviews.title: Internal whale measurements...
customer_reviews.text: I was rather disappointed to find that the whale will not fit my spigot, so I decided (since not finding any reviews with measurement reports) that I would relay measurements (my spigot is 9-1/4" circumference, which is just too big): The internal-clearance measurement of the whale (from the strap slots) is right at 5". The strap (directly inside of the whale) is just over 2-3/4". I don't believe a spigot measuring in excess of 7-3/4" (total circumference) will accommodate this whale. I hope this helps to prevent anyone from making the same mistake that I did!
customer_reviews.author: Illumin8tedAngel

customer_reviews.title: Only works when head is tilted really far back
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as it is getting harder and harder to bathe a wiggly toddler. Was slightly disappointed that it is not exactly as advertised and water still gets into baby's eyes, mouth and ears when I pour it over her head. Figured out though that if I tilt her head back and lean her body backwards the water will not get in her eyes. I'm sure if I used a regular bucket this would work as well. The grooves are a good feature in that it helps to spread out the water somewhat evenly as I pour it over her head. Wasn't too impressed. But I found a way to make it work so will be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: ApplesandpaintTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: This fits my tub perfectly! Super cute and functional. It easily went on and the spout still functions no issues! I definitely feel more confident my little one's head is safe from bumps with this. I would recommend this product to anyone! If my review was helpful please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: S. BarryTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Most importantly, this sling smells musty and grews mildew after just a couple uses. Even though proper drying and washing instructions are followed. The tub is also just too short to use with a 2 month old, or similar size, in the newborn sling. His feet and heels bash the edge, causing him to hurt himself. I would suggest you look elsewhere for a tub with a sling that doesn't grow mildew and has a system that just makes more sense.
customer_reviews.author: OoH La Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Best choice I made was switching to this tub!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a different infant tub. The sling fell too low and my daughters back would be resting on the top of the back rest for the "infant" stage, which is why I think most of these "3 stage tubs" are a flop. THIS tub, is NOT a flop! The design is absolutely perfect. She doesn't slide down, even when the water level is almost to the top of the tub. The mesh is high quality, and the bottom part which you fold up to make into a seat has a foam tube inside, NOT hard plastic. Bath time used to be a disaster. Now she loves it, and it's all because of this tub. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: FS8927

customer_reviews.title: Useless..
customer_reviews.text: I attached a video for you guys to see. Now as a plumber I know that standard spouts are almost of universal size. The spout cover has straps that from the moment you tighten them they reopen and loosen themselves. It cannot stay on the tub for longer than 30 seconds before sliding off of the spout. I literally had to squeeze it to death and wrap electric tape around the spout cover to make it hold. It would be in your best interest to not purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: craig smith

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really work
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't really work as well as it should, and I think it's because of how short the yellow part is. In order to keep the water from running into my toddler's eyes, he either has to tilt his head waaaay back (which he won't do), or we have to rest the yellow part in the middle of the top of his head and wipe away the shampoo with our hands on the front of his head. Kind of defeats the purpose. I've also tried to use it to scoop up bath toys, but it will only collect 1-2 at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Bigredgirl

customer_reviews.title: Small/
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this. And I loved that it matched the water spout cover that was also a blue whale. Unfortunately it seems really small for my standard bathtub. We have a 10-month-old and it seems like there’s just a lot of extra space that it doesn’t cover within the bathtub. I didn’t realize it was going to be this small. So, unfortunately I don’t think I’ll be keeping this, although it is very cute
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It did not fit properly, kept slipping off. Even my two year old said "Mom, it's broken"
customer_reviews.author: Lore

customer_reviews.title: Comes right off
customer_reviews.text: Pointless. It comes right off. Child can just pull it off and play with it. Impossible to adjust strap tight enough to keep it on
customer_reviews.author: Morganmime

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: We are waiting for second child and decided to buy this rinse cup because of good reviews, we were not disappointed. Our 3 years old loves this bath rinser! So easy to use, and so large! It holds a ton of water . It's great for rinsing off baby's head. You can set the plastic rim against baby's forehead and dump it and rinse away. It's so soft it's completely safe and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver!
customer_reviews.text: Went onto our faucet perfectly! Happy with my purchase and might buy another for our other bathroom. Solved my bonking head problem for my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Washing my toddler's hair was always a nightmare. He screams, he runs away, he hides behind the shower curtain, you name it. I tried the visors but they didn't really work and I didn't have high expectations for this product either. However, I was pleasantly surprised how well this works. The cup has a nice weight to it and it's cute. The rim fits perfectly on the forehead and is actually very effective at keeping water out of their eyes. I have my child look up at the ceiling and just use small amounts of water and it is so easy to wash his hair now. It has been a game changer in our bath time routine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Misleading product! Do not buy. Use a cup with holes on the bottom instead. This product does not seal as described, unless the user press abnormally hard on a child's head. The little lanes do not really direct the water, either. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a newborn and absolutely love this tub for her. The sling supports her perfectly. The size of this tub is perfect, big enough that my 3 year old fit in it (when he insisted on trying it out) but small/compact enough that its not obnoxious to store....if you have a standard size bathtub, there is plenty of room to hang this on a suction hook inside the tub to store (and this skip hop tub has its own storage hook to make this simple to do). This is the fourth baby bath that we have owned/tried and it's hands down our favorite. I have no complaints, absolutely love it!!
customer_reviews.author: ETop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great Tub!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bathtub. I went through two others before I saw this on Amazon and decided to give it a go. I am still using the sling at this stage and its worked nicely! It's a really cute tub concept as well with the whale tail shape. I agree with other reviewers that there is a warning sticker on the inside of the tub that starts to peel off after getting water on it, little blue bits in the water for the first few weeks of use. Now there is just a somewhat sticky of a residue that hairs stick to etc. They should put the warning label on the outside perhaps, where you would see it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaB

customer_reviews.title: Hair rinsing whale
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help less trauma for my 3 year old grandson bathing experience. It works. He plays with it until it's ready to be used as the hair rinsing. It's just right. Grandma likes less drama/trauma and more happy faces. It holds about 2 cups of water, maybe a little more? I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYOUNGTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Stick if any texture on the tub
customer_reviews.text: I thought our tub was smooth on the bottom -- apparently there is a very slight texture on the bottom of the tub, so it would not stick at all!!! It would suction to the smooth side of the tub, but I've never seen a bathtub without some type of texture to the bottom for safety reasons. Have to return this cause it wouldn't suction AT ALL on the bottom of the tub. Also the color did not match the other skip hop whale bath spout cover and pour cup- so if it had worked & stuck to the tub floor then it didn't match color wise. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Smelly Mesh
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love love love this bath tub but its just okay for me. The whale is super cute, but like a lot of the other reviewers commented, the mesh starts to smell really bad...after every use we wash and dry it, but after two months ish in, the mesh started smelling and it doesn't really go away. Thankfully my baby can sit up now, but I hated that his hair would smell if we let him lay back after washing his hair....hence we would resort to washing his body in the tub and taking him out to finish up washing his hair. Now that he can sit up, this isn't as big of an issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lee

customer_reviews.title: a cute whale that flopped.
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever. Its very cute and functions but fall off the spout constantly which defeats the purpose of what its meant to do! its impossible to tighten because the one side pops out when you try to tighten it over the spout! I would have returned it if we hadn't already used it. Likely i will purchased something different by the time my 3 month old actually uses the tub.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old was climbing out of our SkipHop tub so I wanted the matching mat to move him to the big tub. Works great and is very cute! The baby like to play with the eyeball. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: A must have item.
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a must have item, I am glad I bougt it for my toddler’s safety. That being said, It is hard to reach diverter to make water come out of the shower rather than the faucet, which is frustrating but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Netting Gave My Son a Rash
customer_reviews.text: The tub seemed to work OK for what we needed it for until the netting apparently started to become moldy (did not show any signs of mold but did smell when up close) which then caused my little ones back to react with some sort of bumpy rash that kind of look like eczema. After we got rid of the tub his back cleared up within a few days or so and so maybe if we had popped the net off and washed it once a week that may not have happened but that is a lot of work. So we ditched the tub and got another one.
customer_reviews.author: ALEXXAJE

customer_reviews.title: Sling grows mold
customer_reviews.text: It is a standard tub. The sling adjusts to three positions depending on the baby’s developmental stage. The issue is that the sling develops a musty smell, and eventually starts growing mold. Cannot find a replacement sling for the tub, so it is unusable until the baby can sit up.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sinha

customer_reviews.title: Best Bath Rinse Cup EVER
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a plastic cup for rinse cup. It does it trick but my kid loves to bite on those. As she grow, I realized the size of the plastic cup isn't giving me enough water to rinse the shampoo off. My friend recommended me with The Skip Hop cup. It is a life saver. The design is very cute and so easy to clean. There is no dead spot for mold. Moreover, the soft edge is perfect to rinse the head since it created a clean edge so the water dont get into your kid's face. I even bought a second one for my friend's new born. Must HAVE for parent !!!!
customer_reviews.author: tct

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade from previous model
customer_reviews.text: I got on to order another bathmat because our previous skip hop mat had ripped on the whale tail. I saw they had this newer item and it looks like they had improved some features that I previously disliked. It is so much better! It feels much better quality. I love that it hangs around the shower head to dry, that the suckers are all over the mat and not just the edges, and that it's heavier and doesn't want to come up and float around. The price is comparable to other similar items so it's a win all around. This is a winning product in my book and I'll be recommending it from this point on!
customer_reviews.author: hop_to_it1230

customer_reviews.title: Cute - Works when it stays on - We like it
customer_reviews.text: Needs a better tightening mechanism. The small side fins have notches that allow for the whale to be squeezed and fitted for various faucet sizes. It still seems to slide off as the rubber notches don't prevent the whale from opening back up to the full size. When it does stay in place, it's great. Serves the purpose of shielding the baby from the hard/sharp tub faucet. Future item should have a better locking mechanism that will keep it from sliding off of the faucet/spout.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: This works GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: For how many times my toddlers (I have 2) have bonked their heads on this whale...I am SO THANKFUL that its just a rubber squishy whale and not the actual hard faucet. It also makes the pull tab for the shower difficult to access so the kiddos can't switch the water stream to shower while the tub is filling up (I usually let my kids sit in the tub while it fills with water). It has a strap that you secure on the bottom and it keeps on it nicely! My kids yank on it constantly and it has NEVER come off from them tampering with it. Highly recommend this - it's fabulous!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie ATop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Misleading ads, water still pour on the face.
customer_reviews.text: I’m one of those who always falls for marketing ads. I saw this and was like yay, my kids are gonna be happy coz water won’t go in their faces anymore. WRONG, the things didn’t really seal or curve along the shape of the head so the water won’t go on their faces. I put it on their heads and started pouring water, the water just poured right over their faces! Not to mention that it’s so uncomfortable holding it in your hand since it’s flat. I ended up donating this and got the other one by Munchkin I got before.
customer_reviews.author: Mint

customer_reviews.title: So far..good buy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product over a month...and its worked out well. Only thing it would be nice if it was longer but both my babies fit in the tub on the mat . I have a slightly textured tub and it does auction..you have to make sure the bottom is wet before and then apply pressure. Easy to hang and dry. No weird smell when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Completely ineffective....
customer_reviews.text: We got the Skip Hop Moby Rinse cup for its intended purpose...which we were led to believe was to keep water out of our childrens’ faces when bathing. The rubber rum, and “waterfall” design actually operate in the opposite fashion, dumping water pretty much directly on faces. I probably should have known better just looking at the design, but it was really cute. What it amounts to is a cute, overpriced bath cup. It doesn’t work on my 1 year old’s head, or the 6 year old’s.
customer_reviews.author: Paul and Tina Whiteside

customer_reviews.title: Cute Little Tub w/ Adjustments
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the first items we added to our baby registry because it was just so cute and simple. It’s been serving us well over the past 9 months and our baby loves her tub time. There are only two things that could be improved: 1. Add more texture to the bottom of floor of the tub- it took our baby a few times to figure out how to stop slipping while sitting up in water. 2. Make some changes to the bottom sling attachment- we could never get it quite right (too much give in the straps) and we would constantly have to twist it back for better bum support.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Best idea and design EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Having a toddler who is so afraid of getting flowing/running water on her face , this brilliant design saved us reducing the water flowing down on her face. We are so used to having screaming bath sessions but this solved those traumatic bath sessions. I believe this is not for tiny babies for the rubber liner to perfectly line up around their heads. I think this is for toddler heads where it perfectly fits their head size and prevent water from flowing on to their face. This does NOT completely stop water from coming down on their faces but still a life saver of a product. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Aswathy Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: how did they know we need this?
customer_reviews.text: It's funny someone else have already thought of it before we had to deal with it. Around 11 months, my baby started to figure out the sprout on the bathtub switches the water to the shower head. It was a hassle wrestling him with it during bath time. My wife came across this item and suddenly the sprout disappeared and it's just an adorable animal! I am simply amazed how easy it is to distract him and how elegant this solution is. Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Terrance

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and ease of mind
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy just went from one of those reclined infant tubs that sits inside our bath to wanting to sit upright on his own directly in the bath. We love the progress but worried that he'd run his head into the edge of the faucet. So glad to have found this simple contraption that fits over the bath faucet. He's definitely run into it a few times and was completely unphased rather than what could have been a big bump, bruise, or worse. Simple and effective product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDad

customer_reviews.title: Nice but doesn't work well on our faucet
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute cover. Easy to clean. It protects my kid from hitting her head on the faucet as long as she doesn't take it off to play with it. But our bath faucet is pretty standard and this doesn't fit properly-- it's a little tricky to put on, and somehow slides toward the end of the faucet within minutes, disrupting the flowing water and diverting some of it into the overflow drain. (We have as yet unresolved issues with the overflow setup, and this means water dripping from the downstairs ceiling.) I wish it would stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Amanda Austin

customer_reviews.title: Don't over think it... just buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! So much better quality than I was expecting. I've seen other households with those foam covers and they always look dented and chewed up. This one is a firm plastic, but definitely softer than a toddler hitting their head on the faucet. It's cute too. Fits well on most faucets - used it at our house and grandparent's house. Our house faucet has the pull thing at the top. The grandparent's house has the pull thing at the bottom, where the water comes out and is a bit wider. The cover fit both of them really easily and wasn't soggy to pack! Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mukul Shekhar

customer_reviews.title: Washing my hair has never been so fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 38 year old male, that is what I identify as and is my truth. I used to hate washing my hair so I stopped years ago. Eventually having a filthy upper scalp caused many problems in my life so I needed to find an answer. I purchased this for my daughter originally, but secretly began using it for myself. This cute little whale and I have such adventures. It changed everything. I got a promotion at work. I learned 3 new languages because I have more time freed up from constantly itching. I also began using conditioner too!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ross

customer_reviews.title: Effective protection that's easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: After a near-miss in the tub, we decided to get one of these. It's a nice big sturdy rubber cover that completely enshrouds any standard tub faucet and its fairly jagged edges. This is a fairly firm rubber, not soft or squishy silicone, which I consider a positive for durability and safety. You can still access the diverter knob, although it's a little tough to get at. Easy installation and simple design should make cleaning easy enough when the time comes. Definitely something I wish we had sooner.
customer_reviews.author: chrisazonian

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I read some mixed reviews on this product, but it has worked really well for me. It fits securely, isn’t very hard to take on and off, and does a good job of covering the faucet so my little ones won’t get hurt bumping their heads on it. As long as you take it off of the faucet most of the time when not in use, I can’t imagine that it would get moldy. It is a firm but not hard plastic, perfect for the application. I’m glad I decided to give it a try, completely satisfied with it, and it makes bathtime so much less stressful!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica N

customer_reviews.title: Great tub, same sticker problem as everyone
customer_reviews.text: We adore this bathtub and love how soft the mesh was for her to lay back on when we used it. The mush was sturdy but easy to remove. It was also positioned in a way where she was able to submerge up to her waist. The things I don’t like about the tub are that the sticker that was on the inside dissolved quickly and left a sticky, gross looking square of gunk that won’t come off even after trying goo gone. The hook also broke off after just a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Cute. A special edition to the bathtub.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new granddaughter born January 28, 2020. I knew it would be awhile before she could actually play with the whale. My 8 year old granddaughter is 100% independent exemption rinsing the shampoo out of her hair. Instead of using her old plastic cup I use the whale to rinse her hair. About the pictures that have been posted with black mold on this product.... Sad! This would not happen if the adults would take the time while cleaning their tub to include the whale. Commonsense 101.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Does it job and perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: We had trouble washing our infant's head, it was literally a disaster every single time. She hated when there was water all over her face. I had different cups, to wash off the soap/shampoo from her hair, but couldn't do it without any water on her face. Then I read reviews and found this cup. And yes- it worked right away! Even without tilting baby's head very far away back, there was almost no water on her face. (I've almost mastered it!) And she didn't cry! Really worked for us! It's just the right size and it saved us lots of nerves.
customer_reviews.author: Sveta

customer_reviews.title: because she can actually remove the whale cover easily and does frequently
customer_reviews.text: Our 15-month old likes to stand up in the bathtub despite our constant asking of her to sit on her bum. Because of this, I worry that she will slip and hit her head, so this is our solution. It's cute and it's padded and though I hope she never falls and smacks her head, if it does happen, I'd rather she smack her head on this than the bare faucet. Minus one star, because she can actually remove the whale cover easily and does frequently, so we're constantly scrambling to put it back on.
customer_reviews.author: bcc

customer_reviews.title: Cute, baby loves BUT it DOES NOT fit. It will slide off.
customer_reviews.text: There is an adjustable strap inside the whale that you can pull taut using the whale's flippers. We did this. We tried using a hair dryer to mold the product a bit better. (Works for some products) It continued to slide off and we decided not to use it. Our son did hit his head in his bath tonight and it's frustrating because we bought this in the hope that this would work for our active little guy. It's easy to clean and the baby enjoys playing with it, but for it's intended purpose, it is useless at least for us.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great except the hook broke off
customer_reviews.text: I thought the design was really cute. For the price tho I didn’t think the hook would just break off like that and I couldn’t put it back. The hook that was use to hang up the tub up just snapped off. It was quite scary: what if my toddler was underneath it when it snapped off. Heard a loud crash when it fell off and I couldn’t put it back since so after I am done with it , it is just chilling in the corner of my bathroom. Definitely an eye sore and waste of space.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Okay. Doesn’t really do what it says it will
customer_reviews.text: Not the best product, but it serves its purpose. I got it because my baby can’t stand having water go on her face. It doesn’t really work perfectly to keep water from going on the face. And when you put the spout on baby’s head, the design prevents it from soaking the middle of the hair down the back (gets the sides). Whale design is cute. Not worth returning but I’m curious how competitor product stacks up.
customer_reviews.author: Coleen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tear free bath times
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver for those who don't have a handheld shower! Currently, we're in temporary housing that doesn't have a handheld shower and makes bath time do much easier and without screaming. This does need a periodic scrub every now and then, but there crevices in the water scooper make it a bit difficult to clean. It's easiest to use a bottle brush to get the inside clean. The bonus of this is that my little one likes to play with it. So, this performs double duty!
customer_reviews.author: aly

customer_reviews.title: Parents don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money. Says it's good for all ages up to toddler but my three month old is too long for it. He has no room to splash and play. The rolling seat does not stay rollers so he slides down. The holes where the sling clicks in is dangerous for little toes and fingers. The plug lays flat at the bottom so when you unplug it the water just sits there. Total waste.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Cute but does not stay on
customer_reviews.text: Yes yes, it's a very cute whale for the tub. However if your child is old enough to move around in the bathtub, please be careful. Unless you have a very tick spout, (unlike ours) it slid out very easily, easily enough for my1yr old to pull it off which defeats the purpose why we bought this item. If you take a look on the underside, you will see that the fins are the straps that fasten to the spout, but with only one strap, it barely keeps it on. I wish there was 2 straps so that it had a better chance of staying put.
customer_reviews.author: Rumi N.

customer_reviews.title: not exactly "universal"
customer_reviews.text: This spout cover is great for safety, however universal doesn't apply to faucets that don't have the pull tab at the end to turn from faucet to shower. Ours is completely flat/smooth and the shower head is turned on under the actual water handle, so this cover slips off. Have put a hair tie around the tail to secure it a little better, and it helps. Will probably put a couples lines of hot glue on the faucet to prevent it from slipping off, as it does most nights. Otherwise great for keeping baby from cracking her little head on the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: yekkersrow

customer_reviews.title: Great for bath time!
customer_reviews.text: This actually works to keep the water off my son’s face. I bought this for him because he HATES water in his face and used to carry on about it during bath time. That’s a thing of the past, thank goodness. I definitely recommend this. The handle makes it easy to hold and it holds quite a bit of water so you’re not bent over pouring cup after cup trying to get the soap out of your kid’s hair, which can feel like forever, just one or two scoops will do ya.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold to my faucet at all
customer_reviews.text: Cute design, and lovely to see, but it did not stay on my faucet at all, which is a real disappointment. My sons will be sharing a tub, and preventing them from bonking their head on the faucet is really important to me. The whale fin design to tighten around the faucet did not help at all, and I have a standard basic faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this little guy! So does my daughter. The waterfall effect it gives from the lines inside, is super cool. It's big enough and holds lot of water so when ur rinsing their hair your not having to continue to grab tons of water while keeping their head back. Now I will say the part that touches their forehead doesn't form all the way. But it does help. That's the only reason I have it 4stars. Other then that I truly loved this product and highly recommend it if you have a baby or toddler.. it's so helpful when washing and rinsing their hair, but also a fun toy in the tub.
customer_reviews.author: littledff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit.
customer_reviews.text: Too large for my spout. It slips off my spout even when adjusted to smallest setting I can put it on. It just doesn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I was beginning to baby safe my bath tub for my growing baby. I wanted something functional and cute! This meets both of those requirements. It looks really adorable in my bath tub and it also keeps my very mobile baby from hitting his head on the water spout. It secures to the water spout fairly well. With enough jerking I'm sure an older toddler could possibly pull it off, but they would really have to be determined. That is the only reason I gave it a 4 star. Aside from that, I really like this product. It is well made and serves the purpose of protecting my baby. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: its great, it's better than a cup or better than always looking for something plastic to scoop water with. stop looking for your 7-11 big gulp cup and buy this. u can use it to wash them and pour water and they will learn to play with it as a toy and learn to love getting water poured on them once they can learn to grab and fill up and pour on their own heads.
customer_reviews.author: chaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great for infants
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how well this would work for toddlers because it requires the head to be leaned back, but my four-month-old baby has a lot of hair, and this works great for him as he’s already reclined in an infant tub. No water gets into his eyes, and he seems to find it funny because he blinks and then giggles when I pour water over his hair. Definitely recommend for babies.
customer_reviews.author: StaceKat80

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to protect my little one during bath time. I have a standard-ish tub spout and this cover fit perfectly. The shower pull sits more towards the wall (back of the spout) and ended up being underneath the tail of the whale but the cover still fits because of the slit on the back of the whale, so it worked out fine. I think this would fit most tub spouts whether the show pull is on the front or back of the spout.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This bath cup has changed the way we are able to wash the soap out of my son's hair. Before purchasing this, it was an absolute nightmare to get soap out- which made me desperate to find a solution quick before he was traumatized by water. I purchased this and was blown away. The size is much bigger than what I was expecting, which makes it so much easier to get all of the soap out with just one pour. The yellow silicone portion helps keep the water where I want it, and not all over his face. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: it's useless if your child wont hold his/her head backwards
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. It's such a battle during bath time, as my son hates getting his hair washed. This product would work if my 15 month old would sit still. I saw other people saying the same thing, but I just wanted to try it out myself. But they were all right....it's useless if your child wont hold his/her head backwards. Now, I'm just using it to rinse off his body.
customer_reviews.author: ORPHEE CAMERON

customer_reviews.title: It works but positioning can be awkward
customer_reviews.text: I like the mesh sling and different positions you can put it in. However, my 4-month-old is not quite ready for the sling to be lowered but moves around so much during baths that he ends up with his legs and rear end over the side and his face nearly under water. I think it will become more comfortable for him once he can sit independently. Atm it is effective (and cute!!) but I spend most of bath time readjusting baby in the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Makes hair washing easier
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used to dislike getting her hair rinsed during bathtime. This rinse cup does a good job keeping water from pouring over her face. Because it's a whale, she's interested in it and tilts her head up rather than down, making it more likely for water to fall behind her instead of over her face. Great product that makes bathtime more fun!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Censky

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job covering the bath nozzle.
customer_reviews.text: We have a very sharp bath nozzle, and I was concerned about one of my girls hitting their head on the sharp edge. I researched bath safety items, and this came up. It was reasonable, had good reviews, and I figured it was worth a shot. I received it, installed it in seconds, and I feel much better when my girls (twins, 14mo) are taking bath. It's fun, and they LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: BEST infant bathtub!
customer_reviews.text: This bathtub beats every other tub we tried for our babies. The adjustable mesh seat lets them sit in different positions and it holds the perfect amount of water. You don't have to wash in a tub or near a sink. The hangar on the back lets you put it aside on a wall hook when you're done. It's sturdy, doesn't rock, and easy to clean. VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Redd06

customer_reviews.title: I'll be adding one to all my baby shower gifts!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it! I didn't buy this because I felt like it was unnecessary but I was wrong! This makes dumping water over my little guys head a little more humane 😂 It really works to keep the water from running down his face! The rubber along the edge makes it comfortable and easy to use tightly against the forehead, I'm really happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: My husband wasn't thrilled when I purchased this for use ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband wasn't thrilled when I purchased this for use Bathing our daughter but after he used it once he couldn't stop saying how much easier it made bathtime and no more daddy soap tears makes it worth it for our family. Hope you try it too your family's worth it and it's a little kid-ling essential 😊
customer_reviews.author: dizzygazelleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant design
customer_reviews.text: Before this, I used a plastic cup to wash my kid's hair and he hated it. My guess is it's because I was dumping a cup of water on his head. Since I got this thing he never cries in the tub anymore. The yellow piece on the end does a wonderful job of spreading the water out so it creates a gently cascading waterfall. Brilliant. So, in conclusion, if you're using a plastic cup to rinse your kid's hair, put it back in the cupboard and get this yellow-lipped blue whale instead. Your kid will thank you. Mine did. Not really, he can't talk yet.
customer_reviews.author: CJN

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy !!️!!️!!️
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy !!️!!️!!️!!️ I am so mad and disgusted by this tub. The mesh sling insert is made of foam on the sides that does not dry and leaves a horrible smell. It’s so awful Such a waste of money It also does not provide any support for the baby and it very difficult to use. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: brian k. williams

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 month old son who we just recently took out of his bath tub seat due to him trying to roll out and play in the water. When he started to crawl around inside the tub he was fascinated with seeing his reflection in the metal circle thing (dont know what its called) under the tub faucet and would get so excited that he would try to stand up to see better, except the faucet was right above it and it freaked me out thinking he would crack his head open on it, so I decided to give this a try and I'm glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not a silver bullet - but still useful
customer_reviews.text: It works (how could a cup not really work), however it is not a silver-bullet - the kid still ducks and runs for the side of the tub, and the little rubber piece is not curved enough to seal by itself on her small head so to be effective I use my off hand to keep it out of her face/eyes. That being said, I would get it again, the handle, the little vanes to help keep the flow even across the front, and the rest make it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My youngest is disabled and we were always scared of her hitting her head on the faucet in her moments of crazy happy during bath time! This is awesome though! Just plop it right on, tighten and you're good to go! You don't even have to remove to make the shower work! I didn't even realize that the spout hole was on the wrong end for our faucet and it still works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie & Sam Angelle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay in place very well
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, but it just doesn't stay in place. The straps used to tighten it don't really help because each time I tighten them to fit the nozzle snugly, one side loosens a notch. I have to place the whale in one perfect spot on my nozzle otherwise it slides right off. I have a normal/standard nozzle like in the description. I still like the cover and won't return it, I just wish there were improvements. It serves it's purpose so my kid has fewer head bruises from bonking his head on the faucet lol.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Hern

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable Design
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a mom favorite and a registry must have but I had difficulty using it and got a simpler rinser. The opening is really wide and the shape is really odd, the slowed water motion is good but you can easily mimic the speed with your hands and a simple rinser. No issues with the quality, it was just a design issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sena Zorlu

customer_reviews.title: We stopped using it
customer_reviews.text: The liner/seat thing isn't easy to use. He kept slipping down and was unable to hold himself up well, and honestly after futzing with this tub for a few weeks I found it a million times easier to wash him without it by just climbing into the bathtub with him. It's not a horrible tub, but I found it to be impractical. If it doesn't make life easier, what's the point?
customer_reviews.author: opiate

customer_reviews.title: Looks more padded than it is
customer_reviews.text: To me, the picture made it look like this was padded. It's not- just regular hard-ish plastic. I do like the ability to hang it to dry- i do this after almost every bath. It is somewhat finicky to hang though. I wish i had gotten a larger/more regularly shaped bath mat- this one does not cover the whole bottom of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, functional, cute
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Functional: Protects our baby from sharp metal edges of the bath spout 2. Well-designed: Fits our bath spout and is sufficiently adjustable for a universal fit 3. Well-made: Sturdy, matte plastic 4. Cute: The whale looks adorable from any angle (unlike a few other alternatives) Cons: 1. Cost: It is the most expensive of all the other bath spout cover options on Amazon (12.99 vs. 7.99 - 9.99) Summary: Worth the price. Buy this if you want to protect the little one from possible scratches while bathing.
customer_reviews.author: summer-dust

customer_reviews.title: Effortless! But water will still get in their eyes
customer_reviews.text: After bathing at least 200 kids over my career of babysitting, this little thing is one of the must in my minimal list of baby gear items. Big cups work the same (sorry - this thing doesn’t keep the water from their eyes), but I’ve never filled, lifted, and dumped a cup of water so effortlessly before! It’s the design of the handle that makes this a game changer. Your kid will still cry if you are not careful, but you’ll get the job done with much more efficiency than a big cup or that tug boat toy :)
customer_reviews.author: David J. Gooldy

customer_reviews.title: Is nice
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, amount of water it holds and the ease of using it during tubby time. The one thing that stops me from giving it five stars is the curved padded section that goes up against my little guys forehead is not curved enough. It is a kind of a flat surface in which it doesn't really keep the water from going in his face as much as I had hoped. Other than that it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more nasty scratch marks.
customer_reviews.text: I should have purchased this a long time ago. My son had several accidents with the faucet and these left some nasty scratch marks on his back. I purchased and installed this in his bath tub. He still stand up underneath the faucet but this cover protected him very well. No more scratch mark since. This is a must for those with young kids.
customer_reviews.author: Din Bui

customer_reviews.title: What suction?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gotten a lot of skip hop products and I haven’t been disappointed... until now. This came rolled up and took forever to unroll enough to lie flat, and has absolutely 0 suction. Now that it’s flat it stays still and we’re keeping it because it matches the bathroom decor, but overall we’re super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bleckley

customer_reviews.title: best tub ever
customer_reviews.text: best tub ever, my baby was born with only 33 weeks and we gave her showers on this tub since the 5th day, it is very confi and holds the baby just fine, she is not 5 mo and her feet go all the way out the tub and she loves it because once she puts them inside, she gets to kick the water, the net holds her just fine, we are giving her about 4 more weeks to take the net out hoping she gets to sit by her self, or just use half the net with her sitting down
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but poorly designed!
customer_reviews.text: This little bucket might be cute but it tips over so easily! I like to fill up a couple buckets with hot water and let them cool down while I wash my baby. Once we're done washing and the water in the buckets has cooled (I use a tub thermometer) I can then rinse the baby off without constantly having to run water to get the right temp (which wastes water). However, this cute little bucket almost always gets bumped and tips over. Also, it doesn't have much capacity. The edge of the bucket dips down (by the tail) for aesthetic appeal but it makes the bucket inefficient!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Smith

customer_reviews.title: I wish I liked this. I was very hopeful because I really ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I liked this. I was very hopeful because I really needed something to cover our bathroom spout to keep my daughter from hitting her head. This spout cover does not seem to want to stay on our shower spout. I have pulled it as tight as it goes and it just will not stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute, nice quality, easy to install, and tail will hold hand-held shower head!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install. My daughter hasn't hit her head against it, so I can't rate how well it actually works in terms of protecting little heads. It's a nice tough plastic, so I'd imagine that if she did hit her head, it would hurt substantially less than if we didn't have this cover. I like that the tail can hold our hand-held shower head - it's very convenient to have it easily reachable when I am on me knees giving her a bath.
customer_reviews.author: B. W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: This whale keeps my kids from hitting the faucet. It’s pretty easily knocked off, hence the 4 stars. I’ve tried tightening it, but it didn’t make much difference. That could be partially due to the shape of the faucet, but it works well enough to keep using it. The inside can get a bit gross, so remember to take it off and clean the inside. I’ve run it through my dishwasher on the top rack with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute little non-slip mat
customer_reviews.text: We love this little mat so much we bought 2. We use one in the tub and on the second we cut off the top strip (sorry whale!) so it will fit in the kitchen sink when the kiddo *needs* a wash, but not a full bath production. The channels made that super simple we don't have to worry about an edge sticking up.
customer_reviews.author: Orange

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Has lasted over 13 months
customer_reviews.text: I just got on amazon to buy baby wash clothes and realized it's been 13 months since I bought this guy! Its stayed in perfect condition. It's not the easiest or most comfortable to hold, but lasts forever. Our one before this didnt last 6 months before the rubber piece fell off. And this is $14 at Walmart here. Good for the $7 in here!!!
customer_reviews.author: leslie k

customer_reviews.title: Slides off of the spout!
customer_reviews.text: Ive provided a photo to show the type of spout that i have.... it doesn't have the shower lifter... it's just the spout...I'm not sure if that has something to do with it sliding off so easily but it was the first time using this spout cover tonight and it kept sliding off of the spout! No matter how tight i pulled the adjustment strap, it just kept sliding off. It's too bad because it's really cute and if it stayed on it would be exactly what i need so it's pretty disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Lettie

customer_reviews.title: This product seems like false advertising
customer_reviews.text: This product seems like false advertising. It’s well built and sturdy but the yellow plastic on the mouth of the cup is hard and does not mold to the child’s head, this if they’re not looking all the way back and/or look forward, it’s going to get into their face/eyes/ears. It’s also not made for a child with a small head. You have to turn it sideways which then repeats the above scenario. It might work as they progress into a toddler but as an infant, this doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Cute design, but that’s about it!
customer_reviews.text: Cute design, however, tons of water still gets in my toddler eyes. I use it properly and have watched how to videos, but doesn’t work the best for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kadejah

customer_reviews.title: My 2yo can remove this easily
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars because it does it's job, is quite durable, easy to clean, easy to attach and easy to remove. That being said, my kids pull it off the faucet over and over. Bath time is a constant battle of "no, don't touch" with my 2yo. It slides over the faucet and there's a strap attached to both sides that goes through the middle of the whale. I wish it was harder to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put on and has saved my son several times! My son has hit his head on this; has been standing and then fallen on it and he never even acted like he hit anything. There’s a spot for the bath to shower knobby thing. Makes it a little harder to turn it into a shower, but it also deters my son from playing with the button.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls off
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if the shape of your faucet goes from thicker to thinner. This doesn't stay on even after adjusting with the strap. As of last night my one year old started pulling it off. I had looked at a few and thought I had grabbed the one with 2 straps. I wish I had kept the box instead of recycling before trying out. A complete waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Russell zierenberg

customer_reviews.title: Will not suction.  Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So. My tub is not super slippery. It is one of those old plastic tub fitter systems. This mat will NOT suction at all. Kept the mat in while I filled the tub, I tried stepping on each suctuon cup, and it just wont work. The mat turned into more of a slipping hazard for my toddler than without it. I would 100% return it, if I still had the box.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay "tight"
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to allow you to tighten down using the flippers. Unfortunately, the flippers don't stay pulled out more than a few minutes. As a result, it pops off every time the water hits it a little bit. Was expecting more. We have the matching whale water scoop that is great!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Love this stupid thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those items you might think, nah, I won't really need that! But let me tell you, this thing really does work to keep the water out of baby's eyes and is awesome. It's hard enough bathing a newborn and rinsing their tiny heads without getting soap and water in their eyes. We pour it over her head and she loves it. We also use it to keep her warm during bath and pour water over her body. When Grandma first saw me do it she said, "You're crazy! Don't pour water like that over her head." But then she saw how it worked and loved it too.
customer_reviews.author: greenkarma

customer_reviews.title: Love this product! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! I’ve never worried about spending money on stuff like this and after using this I will forever question if little gadgets are worth it! Every time I use it I think how amAzing it is! It sounds weird but it’s very accurate on where the water goes and actually keeps the water out of my babies & my toddlers eyes! Amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Candice
